poem:
Title: "Newcomer's Serenade"

In the fresh dawn of curiosity,
Forged in the sanguine ink of the Guardian,
I see a scribe unversed in American chancellery,
Journeying through curious lands of the podium.

Replete with fresh naivety and earnest quest,
Into her hands, the baffling realm of Newt,
A stranger in a town of known jest,
Election's carousel in a foreign suit.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Could student protesters turn the 2024 election? Hello, and welcome to the Guardian’s brand new US election newsletter. I moved to the US from the UK as a keen but inexperienced reporter in 2011, and was immediately plunged into covering the 2012 presidential election, despite having next to no knowledge of American politics. After the ignominy of travelling to a Newt Gingrich campaign event and having to ask an audience member who Newt Gingrich was,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Could student protesters turn the 2024 election? Hello, and welcome to the Guardian’s brand new US election newsletter. After the ignominy of travelling to a Newt Gingrich campaign event and having to ask an audience member who Newt Gingrich was,
